answers.question: Telegram Handle We Can Use To Contact You
Link to your Public Group Chat
Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.

answers.answer:
Geodework's North Star is the geographic decentralization of Ethereum, which is arguably the most interesting OSS project the world has ever seen. 

Ethereum is a global network that comes into form as a result of geographically distributed “local nodes” (technical, social, organizational). Ethereum is deeply rooted in geography. As a case-in-point, imagine that 100% of validator nodes or 100% of Ethereum devs were located in one region. Here, the role of physical geography in Ethereum becomes instantly clear: it’s existential to the censorship resistance of the open-source network that is Ethereum. And thus, Ethereum needs people whose job it is to think about and work towards the geographic decentralization of strategic ecosystem variables. But crucially, we also need people to “do” and do with an emphasis on urgency, clean, crisp execution, and excellence. 


And so at a high-level, Geodework does Ethereum/L1 ecosystem development with a focus on the geographic decentralization of Ethereum, and therefore contributes to the growth of the OSS ecosystem.  In practice, this means we build ecosystem products and we source, curate, support, and fund builders and organizations contributing to the OSS ecosystem. While operating as an internal team at the EF, we: 

* Helped facilitate the creation of OSS-minded orgs such as The Red Guild, 0xPARC, BuidlGuidl, ETHKipu

* Built up education ecodev efforts by supporting professors and student groups at universities around the world such as TUM, Princeton, KTH, UTokyo, BITS Pilani.

* Sourced and executed 100+ geo grants,  many OSS-related, reaching communities like ETHTaipei, EthereumTGU, ETHKL, SpaghettiETH, ETHCluj, Ethereum Argentina, and many others.


All of which contribute to the OSS ecosystem, through the education, content, applications, and tools created as a result. 

Geodework continues to do similar work, e.g.,

* Building educational and community infra products and tools, e.g., ([Local Ethereum](https://localethereum.beehiiv.com/), Ethereum Job Board, and more to come)
* Facilitating Ethereum-focused grant giving
* And executing on public goods work of global Ethereum ecosystem development
answers.question: How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.

answers.answer:
We focus on the geographic decentralization, which to our knowledge is not an area of ecodev explicitly focused on within Ethereum, and building community infrastructure products.

Geodework spun out of the Ethereum Foundation and formed an independent organization because there are virtually no organizations within the Ethereum ecosystem, outside the EF, that treat Ethereum ecodev as a first class citizen and execute towards a mandate of global Ethereum ecosystem development — much less geo ecodev. This is the core of our differentiation.
answers.question: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?

answers.answer: Continue building out educational and community infra products and tools like [Local Ethereum](https://localethereum.beehiiv.com/), facilitating grant-giving, and executing on the public goods work of global Ethereum ecosystem development. We plan to use the funds to cover our community infrastructure work and ecodev operational costs.
answers.question: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?

For any project deploying smart contracts on blockchain networks, please list all your deployer addresses and their corresponding blockchain networks. Use this format for each entry: [deployer_address], [chain_id]—for example, 0x123abc..., 42161 (This represents a deployer address on the Arbitrum network). Please include a separate line for each unique deployer address and blockchain combination.

project.title: Geodework
project.description:
## Who?

[Geodework](https://geodework.com/) is a spin-out organization of the Ethereum Foundation dedicated to global Ethereum ecosystem development.

Prior to spinning out, we at Geodework were an internal EF team called Generalist Ecodev. As its name suggests, Generalist Ecodev served a “general” ecodev function. Which means, we did Ethereum ecodev with a broad, general mandate in mind and thought about Ethereum ecodev as an object in its own right. 

For instance, just as protocol development is an object that consists of technical work streams like “scaling research” or “client development”, ecosystem development is an object that consists of work streams largely having to do with community infrastructure: “org building,” “developer growth,” “education or regional ecodev,” etc, etc. And within this frame, Generalist Ecodev accomplished a lot. We: 

* Helped facilitate the creation of orgs such as The Red Guild, 0xPARC, BuidlGuidl, ETHKipu 
* Built up education ecodev efforts by supporting professors and student groups at universities around the world such as TUM, Princeton, KTH, UTokyo, BITS Pilani. 
* Sourced and executed 100+ geo grants, reaching communities like ETHTaipei, EthereumTGU, ETHKL, SpaghettiETH, ETHCluj, Ethereum Argentina, and many others. 
* Among other wins 

Over time, Generalist Ecodev came to focus more and more on the “regional or grassroots development” (“geo ecodev”) stream because of its importance: Ethereum is a global network that comes into form as a result of geographically distributed “local nodes” (technical, social, organizational). Ethereum is deeply rooted in geography. As a case-in-point, imagine that 100% of validator nodes or 100% of Ethereum devs were located in one region. Here, the role of physical geography in Ethereum becomes instantly clear: it’s existential to the censorship resistance of the network. 

And so Ethereum needs people whose job it is to think about and work towards the geographic decentralization of strategic ecosystem variables. But crucially, we also need people to “do” and do with an emphasis on urgency, clean, crisp execution, and excellence. 

Generalist Ecodev, now Geodework, has been one such example of a group of people. 


## What?

Geodework will pursue the geographic decentralization of Ethereum in a similar vein as our EF team had done. We will continue to source and support talented grassroots contributors and facilitate grants. And we’ll continue to do our brand of execution-oriented geo ecodev.

Concretely, Geodework is an ecosystem product studio dedicated to global Ethereum ecosystem development and as such building a better Internet. Which means we will:

* Build educational and community infra products and tools, e.g., (Local Ethereum, Ethereum Job Board, and more to come)
* Facilitate Ethereum-focused grant giving
* And execute on public goods work of global Ethereum ecosystem development

## Why?

Geodework spun out of the Ethereum Foundation because there are virtually no organizations within the Ethereum ecosystem, outside the EF, that treat Ethereum ecodev as a first class citizen and execute towards a mandate of global Ethereum ecosystem development — much less geo ecodev. And we think that needs to change. 

Ethereum requires and deserves a multitude of competent Ethereum-first orgs that come with their own unique perspectives and approaches to solving problems. 

Just as the space values core protocol development and client diversity, we believe it needs to come to equally value core ecosystem development and community infra diversity. And just as Ethereum is more robust with multiple client teams, Ethereum will be more robust with multiple community infra teams. 

## Where?

Worldwide 


## How?

We will execute primarily by:

* Building out educational and community infra products and tools
* Facilitating grant-giving 
* And execute on public goods work of global Ethereum ecosystem development

## When?

Now. 

Ethereum must win now.
